member.name: T:Suna.Blocks.BlockifiedModule
member.summary: A collection of blocks of code; a blockification is just a process of splitting a source file into manageable sections; functions, inlines, etc.

member.name: P:Suna.Blocks.BlockifiedModule.Main
member.summary: Gets the "main" block

member.name: T:Suna.Blocks.InlineBlock
member.summary: Represents a block in the code that starts with the "inline" keyword. It's a function type syntax that is evaluated somewhat like a C macro expansion.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of class InlineBlock

member.name: P:Suna.Blocks.InlineBlock.Name
member.summary: Gets the block's name

member.name: M:Suna.Blocks.InlineBlock.Compile(Suna.Link.LinkContext,Suna.Groups.ParentheticGroup)
member.summary: Compiles the block to the given context with the given parameters

member.name: T:Suna.Blocks.MainBlock
member.summary: Class representing the block indicated by the "main" keyword

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of class MainBlock

member.name: M:Suna.Blocks.MainBlock.Compile(Suna.Link.LinkContext)
member.summary: Compiles the block

member.summary: Class that groupifies tokens

member.summary: Compiles this object into the given context

member.summary: Adds all tokens in the enumerator to this object

member.name: T:Suna.Groups.GroupItem
member.summary: Represents an item in our grouped view of the code; this is just my way of dealing with the hierachical nature of code. A GroupItem can be: - a token - a group of items bounded by brackets or parentheses - other things as I see fit

member.name: P:Suna.Groups.GroupItem.IsIdentifier
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the item is an identifier

member.name: T:Suna.Groups.InvokeGroupItem
member.summary: Represents an "invocation", which as a spot in the code where an identifier is followed by a parenthetical.

member.name: M:Suna.Groups.InvokeGroupItem.#ctor(Suna.Groups.GroupItem,Suna.Groups.GroupItem)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of class InvokeGroupItem
member.param: the identifier of the thing being invoked

member.name: M:Suna.Groups.InvokeGroupItem.Compile(Suna.Link.LinkContext)
member.summary: Compiles the item

member.name: M:Suna.Groups.TokenGroupItem.Compile(Suna.Link.LinkContext)
member.summary: Compiles the item in the given context

member.name: M:Suna.Link.LinkContext.CompileInvocation(System.String,Suna.Groups.ParentheticGroup)
member.summary: Compiles the invocation of the invokable item with the given name, using the given parameters.
member.param: the name of the invokable item

member.summary: Represents the final result of a compile/link operation

member.summary: Appends the given chunk of machine code to the output

member.summary: Returns the image

member.name: T:Suna.Link.Linker
member.summary: Linker class; it's job is to take a module and convert it to code. Compilation is done as-needed, so we get called from the top level of the process and invoke compilation as necessary.

member.name: M:Suna.Link.Linker.Link(Suna.Link.LinkContext)
member.summary: Links the given module

member.name: T:Suna.Regions.Region
member.summary: Represents a region in the code; this is generally just either a normal Suna region or a region marked as Javascript.

member.name: T:Suna.Regions.RegionizedModule
member.summary: A source module broken up into regions; currently the only purpose is to separate sections of JavaScript from sections of Suna.

member.summary: Compiles the given module

member.summary: Gets information about the token

member.name: M:Suna.Tokens.Token.CreateBlock(Suna.Tokens.Token[])
member.summary: Creates a Block from the given list of tokens; this is called on the block-header token (e.g. "function" keyword), so that the correct type of block can be created. Blocks that are not block-start tokens should just call the base implementation, i.e. they should throw the error that we throw below.

member.name: M:Suna.Tokens.Token.Compile(Suna.Link.LinkContext)
member.summary: Compiles the token; in general a single token doesn't mean enough by itself to be compilable, but give them the option

member.name: M:Suna.Tokens.Token.ToString
member.summary: Returns a string representation of the object.

member.name: M:Suna.Tokens.Tokenizer.Tokenize(Suna.Regions.SunaRegion)
member.summary: Creates a TokenizedModule for the SourceModule
